H0.text: Hemoglobin is the protein in red blood cells that transports oxygen around the body.

H1.text: Plasma is the protein in red blood cells that transports oxygen around the body.

H2.text: Hydrogen is the protein in red blood cells that transports oxygen around the body.

H3.text: Hematocrit is the protein in red blood cells that transports oxygen around the body.

A4.text: Hemoglobin (haemoglobin, Hb or Hgb) is a protein containing iron that facilitates the transportation of oxygen in red blood cells.

A5.text: Almost all vertebrates contain hemoglobin, with the sole exception of the fish family Channichthyidae.
